intro: Paepalanthus armeria, commonly known as the desert lily, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of South America. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant has a rosette of thick, fleshy leaves that help it store water, adapting to its harsh, dry environment. It produces a tall stem bearing clusters of flowers, which bloom in late summer or early autumn. Paepalanthus armeria is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand extreme temperatures and limited rainfall.
